FuncDef: The display ip routing-table command displays the summary of an IPv4 routing table. The display ip routing-table command displays the summary of an IPv4 routing table.
CLIs: display mrt routing-table [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] [ <prefix> [ [ <mask> ] | [ <masklength> ] ] [ longer-match ] ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a table of a producer.
-

Indicates a multicast static routing table. (When topology topology-name is specified, the multicast static routing table cannot be displayed.).
-

Displays information about a route to a specified IP destination address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask of a destination address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a mask length. The 1s in each 32-bit mask must be consecutive. Therefore, a mask in dotted decimal notation can be presented by a mask length.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

Displays detailed information about all the routes in the routing table, including active and inactive routes. If this parameter is not specified, only brief information about active routes is displayed.
-

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

Displays the routes matching the specified network or mask.
-
